column2: eastgurl2001, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started out on Metoprolol, then was put on Ziac, my gyno found out I was on Ziac and demanded that I be put on something else so I was put on Labetalol 200mg bid, then due to stressfull situations I was raised to 300mg bid, then I found myself in a totally unstressfull situation, (mother in-law passed away, we moved and I changed jobs :)) and then the medicine lowered my h.r. too much, so doc lowered my does to 200mg 1xd, my pulse is still low and my b.p is reading in the low 110/68 most of the time, I have asked my doctor to remove me from the medication, and I have been off the meds for  over 1 month and I have had excellent results.  Apparently my high bp and high pulse was in response to stress. This medication was beneficial while I learned how to deal with my stressful situations and is no longer needed.

column2: Julescat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This was the first HBP pill I was ever on. BP usually 140-150/80's range w/out drug. Overweight by about 80-100 lbs and not good dealing with stress (which combined is why I feel I have HBP to being with). Was on Latetalol for about 1 month, just weened off. Feel so much better, tho BP still needs addressed. This pill did nothing but give me side effects. Lowered HR but not BP (couple of pts maybe). I experienced scalp tingling; dry eyes, nose, sinuses, mouth, and throat; constipation which has apparently lead to development of hemmeroids (nice!); short, infrequent bouts of tinitus (read online about ototoxic drugs - another nice!), bloody nose (from dryness), extreme tireness and could barely workout. Felt like I was gonna fall off the eliptical from lack of energy after 5 minutes! How are you suppose to lose weight to help control BP naturally when this stuff makes you a big sloth with no energy?! Would wake up at night unable to breath through my nose 'cause it was stuffed up. Had indigestion - food felt like a lump in stomach. Just not a good pill AT ALL for me. Suppose to start CLonidine, but after reading those reviews, I am rethinking. I know I am risking health problems going untreated, but I do not like pharmacutical treatment. I am going to try niacin for vasodialation, exercise along with yoga and meditation, therapy and diet changes instead. My Dr. didn't even know niacin was a vasodialator (uh, hello?). Think I need new Dr. too while I am at it. Seems effects are severe or not based on the individual. I've never taken other drugs so maybe I'm just sensetive. Didn't like AT ALL! Had best work-out in weeks last night while off this drug. Felt good!

column9: I was switched to this medication around my 25th week of pregnancy when the Atenolol I had previously been on stopped working. It did remove the headaches and swelling which I see as a con because if I was not checking my readings several times a day, my main warning signals for elevated pressure were gone.  I thought this made this medication really dangerous.  During the pregnancy I did experience the extreme nipple burning sensation that was horrible and the nausea once I got on the higer dose.  After the pregnancy I was so dizzy and I could barely take care of my baby for the first two weeks because I couldn't stand up without the room spinning and feeling like my ears were full of water.  It was really scary and I started to think I would never get better.  After stopping the medication and switching back to the Atenolol and adding hydrochlorothorizde all the crazy side effects went away but my bp is still up.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
essentialhypertension, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've had hypertension since age 26 and have used beta blockers majority of the time. At age 43 and pregnant I used Labetalol and it was effective in controlling my blood pressure. One month after giving birth I was still feeling exhausted and foggy feeling. My doctor slowly returned me to Atenolol and it was like an immediate change. No more foggy-headedness; my head felt clearer and I was less tired. How I felt while on Labetalol and off it was like night and day. It was amazing considering I was starting to think I was experiencing postnatal depression. Anyone experiencing this after pregnancy should really talk to their doctor to see if Labetalol is the cause. For me, it was a very effective drug while pregnant (and possibly saved mine and baby's life) but not so helpful after baby was born.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: Labetalol was first given to me to treat hypertension ranging from 140/90 to 161/105 and was highly effective in lowering it to normal levels under 120/80. The downside to it was extreme fatigue. I actually have to take 50 mg twice a day even though the lowest dose is 100 mg. (I have to take 2 half pills per day)The 100 mg twice per day was too much for me and caused extreme dizziness and I felt almost like I might pass out. Taking a half a pill twice per day (morning and evening) has caused no other side effects other than being very tired and has been very effective at keeping my blood pressure within normal ranges.

Left hand swelled up yesterday and has come down only slightly today. Sleepy after taking it-sometimes just not able to function normal, lightheaded
